arm_group.description: Patients in TACE group receive transarterial chemoembolization (TACE) one month after resection.
Patients in Control group receive no management.

brief_summary.textblock:
Circulating tumour cell (CTC) count could reflect the effect of postoperative transarterial
      chemoembolization (TACE) on hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) recurrence.

clinical_study.brief_title: Decrease in Circulating Tumour Cell Count Reflects the Effectiveness of Postoperative Adjuvant Transarterial Chemoembolization (TACE) in Preventing Hepatocellular Carcinoma Recurrence

detailed_description.textblock:
Early metastases of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) may be detected by the isolation of
      circulating tumor cells (CTCs) in the bloodstream. During the course of therapeutic
      attempts, monitoring CTC changes in patients with HCC is helpful for the efficacy
      assessment. Nevertheless, the markers used for the detection, such as a-feto protein,
      asialoglycoprotein receptor or epithelial cell adhesion molecule, CD133 or CD90, are not
      specific for HCC CTCs. In spite of these limitations, a timely determination of the
      existence of CTCs will be beneficial for the monitoring of distant metastases, the
      evaluation of therapeutic attempts, and the prediction of prognosis.

facility.name: Department of Interventional Radiology; Cancer Center; Guangdong General Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Decrease in Circulating Tumour Cell Count Reflects the Effectiveness of Postoperative Adjuvant Transarterial Chemoembolization (TACE) in Preventing Hepatocellular Carcinoma Recurrence

primary_outcome.description: The time points for blood collection to count CTC were1)one day before TACE(also one month after resection);2)three days after TACE;3)one month after TACE;4) two months after TACE;5)three months after TACE;6)six months after TACE;7) one year after TACE.
primary_outcome.measure: Change of circulating tumor cell(CTC) count at different timepoints
primary_outcome.time_frame: time before TACE and time after TACE

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Investigator), Primary Purpose: Screening
